page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY 4
page.content:
The lordship became known as 'Queen Hope' as a result of Queen Eleanor's possession of it (1283-1290) and her visit there on her way to Caernarvon before Edward II's birth, later to become Prince of Wales.{(Local {history)} The woollen{industry}provided the country's principal export and was extensively practised in Hope and Caergwrle. There were half a dozen mills existing here in the 14th century.
The Lordship of Hope achieved a great honour by becoming one of the first 'boroughs' in Wales to be granted a Charter in 1359. In 1402, during Owain Glyndwr's fight for Welsh independance, Queen Hope was sacked by his rebels.
